title: Riot Instead of Nerfing Cinderhulk
body:
look at what it's competing with.

The mage jungle item, well, yea. How often do you see mage junglers not using cinderhulk.

As for warrior, it wouldn't really hurt to revert the incredibly overwhelming 5 ad nerf. It's not much of a change and it will help a little.

I pretty much exclusively build devourer, so hear me out on this.


When season 5 came, the lee sins and the vi players and the rek'sais, etc. were all excited, I'm sure.
There were even some hooplah's coming from tank junglers with juggernaut and now cinderhulk.
But in a little corner you can see {{champion:266}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:56}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:19}} ( Exception of 4.20) {{champion:77}} 

Now while I'm not sure this is the way to go about changing devourer, but what was really wrong with starting out with 40 damage on hit?
It didn't give you extra damage on your ad scaling like warrior.
It didn't offer tankyness like juggernaut.
When was the last time you saw someone legitimately build devourer and do well?
Devourer is for attack speed reliant champions, who generally do better off later in the game. Champions who build devourer should be trying to farm and get stronger so they can win the late game, not be forced into risky stat gains on ganks.

Season 5 introduced DoT heavy jungle items, which isn't what these types of champions want.
These champions want reliable stats that give them raw power in terms of clearing the jungle and fighting champions.

What I'm suggesting is, and I know a lot of people are going to hate me for this, another jungle item path, seperate from the machete line.

Maybe something along the lines of a knife or something that would be like the hunter's machete from late season 4, which upgrades into something like madreds and then something like wriggles.

Also make it so that they can purchase items from the machete line (excluding the full on upgrades) so these current devourer users can also have different options like sustain (trailblazer) counterjungling (poacher's knife) and dueling (skirmisher's). These types of champions generally don't want poacher's knife. but it can still be an option.

What this introduction of raw stat scaling like a feral flare would re-introduce is junglers not only being aware of the enemy laners, but the enemy jungler as well. This would make champions like {{champion:64}} {{champion:35}} become strong again due to powerful counterjungling options to limit these feral flare champions.

These feral flare champions should be shitty early. That's what they're for. But these champions can also deal with cinderhulk later due to the magic/hybrid damage their jungle item offers, so cinderhulk users have to itemize more carefully. 
The game should really turn into Feral Flare>Cinderhulk>Warrior>Feral Flare
This would introduce more champion diversity throughout the game, and more thinking in champion select.
Raw damage would also give completely random champions who shouldn't be in the jungle a chance to jungle, which would give really creative options.

On a side note, feral flarers would still be a little weak, so it would be nice if riot could also reduce the respawn time of jungle camps a little. Maybe between what it was in season 4 and what it is now.

TL;DR Give devourer users raw damage options like feral flare to introduce a healthy champion selection pool for the jungle, and reduce jungle spawn times.

Cinderhulk gives 375 health for the initial 2250 gold with an immolate passive. Compare that with Warmog's (250 gold more) or Sunfire (350 gold more) and we see that Cinderhulk isn't nearly as cost efficient when it is bought. Warrior gives 40 AD and 10 armor pen AND 10% CDR for the same price. The reason Cinderhulk is strong is that it is a scaling item, it gives the incentive to build more tanky items to benefit more from the item. Warrior is about raw damage as early as possible. Both items do what they are supposed to. And are nearly equally strong in terms of how they promote the playstyle associated with their users. 

I do agree that Magus and Devourer need buffs. Magus may need a rework. I think Devourer just needs it's base damage back.

Let's consider the additional summoner spell modification of cinder hulk variants. How much is the champ slow/execute or mini exaughst with true dmg added worth? To some champs the additional cc with an upgraded machete item has made all the difference, making the additional smite abilities an extremely powerful tool at the cost of merely 850 gold. That you can immediately turn around and upgrade that item into something that has already offered you cc outside of your kit and make it also give you offensive, defensive, and camp clear stats is about as broken at it gets. The hidden power if the new smite abilities is what makes balancing this item difficult. Not it's passive stats. It's why the nerf on pbe seems to be a good direction.
